intro: Bonjeanea hirsuta var. viridis, commonly known as the green hirsute bonjeanea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
